New Records: Mark Wood brought up his 50th wicket in T20 Internationals.
Key Match Events: Phil Salt slammed the first two balls for six before chopping on to the third ball of the innings.
Mark Wood and Jofra Archer took three wickets apiece to help skittle Oman for just 47 in 13.2 overs.
Jofra Archer ended with figures of 3/12 from 3.2 overs.
Adil Rashid picked 4/11 in his four overs.
England chased down the target of 48 in 3.1 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and opted to bowl first against Oman in North Sound, Antigua.
Captain Jos Buttler announced one change to the playing XI, with Reece Topley replacing Chris Jordan.
Post-Match Reflections: The win is exactly what England required to turn Group B’s NRR equation on its head.
Oman’s total of 47 all out in 13.2 overs handed England's batters a terrific opportunity to make a big statement, which they duly took.
England now have a superior net run rate to second-placed Scotland in Group B, so would qualify for the Super 8 should they beat Namibia and Scotland fail to get a point against Australia.
For Oman, this fourth defeat in the group was the most disappointing performance of the campaign, but they showed plenty in earlier matches to offer hope for the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's pace attack proved too strong for Oman, with significant contributions from Mark Wood, Jofra Archer, and Adil Rashid.
